words.definition: If something is beneath something else, it is under it.
words.example: The cat was sitting beneath the table.

words.definition: A cub is a baby animal, such as a bear or lion.
words.example: The lion cub was crying for its mother.

words.definition: Dawn is the time of day when the sun rises.
words.example: At dawn, the sun gently rose over the farm.

words.definition: If you are dissatisfied, you are not happy with something.
words.example: I was dissatisfied with their decision to work on Sunday.

words.definition: When something is done with ease, it is not hard to do.
words.example: The monkey climbed the tree with ease.

words.definition: When something is evident, it is easy to see or understand.
words.example: It was evident from his face that he was sad.

words.definition: Hail is small pieces of ice that fall from the sky.
words.example: The hail damaged the roof of the car.

words.definition: To howl is to make a long, loud sound like a wolf.
words.example: The wolf howled at the moon.

words.definition: To leap is to jump a long distance.
words.example: The athlete leaped over the hurdle.

words.definition: If something is magnificent, it is very beautiful and grand.
words.example: The palace was magnificent.

words.definition: A necessity is something that you must have.
words.example: Water is a necessity for life.

words.definition: An outcome is the result of something.
words.example: What was the outcome of the meeting?

words.definition: A pile is a group of things that are on top of each other.
words.example: There was a pile of books on the table.

words.definition: If something is profound, it is very deep or intelligent.
words.example: He had a profound understanding of the subject.

words.definition: To seize something is to grab it quickly and strongly.
words.example: The police seized the drugs.

words.definition: To squeeze something is to press it from both sides.
words.example: She squeezed the lemon to get the juice out.

words.definition: If something is supreme, it is the highest or best.
words.example: The supreme court is the highest court in the country.

words.definition: If something is terrific, it is very good.
words.example: We had a terrific time at the party.

words.definition: A trait is a quality that a person has.
words.example: Honesty is a good trait to have.

words.definition: If something is vital, it is extremely important or necessary.
words.example: It is vital to eat healthy food.
